intro: Hieracium alaricum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium alaricum is often found in high-altitude habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
